org.openadaptor.auxil.convertor.xml
Class OrderedMapToXmlConvertor

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.core.Component
      org.openadaptor.auxil.convertor.AbstractConvertor
          org.openadaptor.auxil.convertor.xml.OrderedMapToXmlConvertor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Administrable, IComponent, IDataProcessor
public class OrderedMapToXmlConvertor
extends AbstractConvertor

Converts IOrderedMaps to XML documents or XML strings. Note that Map keys containing forward slashes are not permitted as Element tags in XML. These will be mapped according to the value of mappedSlashValue. If this property hasn't been explicitly set, a warning issues each time a conversion is made. If it is set, no warning will issue. The default value for mappedSlashValue is DEFAULT_SLASH_SUBSTITUTE

Author:
Eddy Higgins

setMappedSlashValue

public void setMappedSlashValue(java.lang.String mappedSlashValue)
Assign a substutionValue for slashes in element names.

Forward slashes are not permitted as part of an element name. Dom4j Doesn't prevent them, but it could cause a problem when subsequently parsing the converted XML

Parameters:
mappedSlashValue -

getMappedSlashValue

public java.lang.String getMappedSlashValue()

convert

public java.lang.Object convert(java.lang.Object record)
                         throws RecordException
Convert an OrderedMap into xml Representation. Depending on the returnXmlAsString Property it will return a String representation of the Xml, or an org.dom4j.Document.

Specified by:
convert in class AbstractConvertor
Parameters:
record - IOrderedMap
Returns:
String containing an XML representation of the supplied ordered map
Throws:
RecordException - if the record is not an IOrderedMap
